stanza.line: I never saw that you did painting needneed
And therefore to your fair no painting setset
I found (or thought I found) you did exceedexceed
That barren tender of a poet debtdebt
And therefore have I slept in your reportreport
That you your self being extant well might showshow
How far a modern quill doth come too shortshort
Speaking of worth what worth in you doth growgrow
This silence for my sin you did imputeimpute
Which shall be most my glory being dumbdumb
For I impair not beauty being mutemute
When others would give life and bring a tombtomb
There lives more life in one of your fair eyeseyes
Than both your poets can in praise devisedevise
